Subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test

X-Mailer: Internet Mail Service (5.5.2653.19)

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
From: Jeff Langr <JLangr@...>

Kent appeared to be opposed to the idea.  Fine, I just wanted to offer a
different viewpoint on why I'd like the feature.  But I do appreciate the
efforts to keep JUnit nice & lean.

IOW, I'm wishy washy.

-Jeff 

-----Original Message-----
From: Vladimir Bossicard
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 7/26/2001 2:20 PM
Subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test

> I think Jeff has hit the nail on the head, I too would like to be
> able to get some feedback when the number of asserts has changed
> for the same reasons.
> 
> Seems to me that the simplest thing that could possibly work is
> to count the asserts.

If Erich/Kent give their ok, it will be done in the next release (or
even sooner if we have a 3.7.1 release)

I am not a "assert count" fan (because I _personnaly_ don't need it and
I don't see the real added value) but if other people really want this
feature, I vote for it.

-Vlad

subject: RE: [junit] Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test
